FAQ:
>Can anyone have an out of body experience?
Yes, this is a natural part of being human that has been mostly forgotten.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A successful astral projection feels just as, often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months or more to attain this ability?
No, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries. Fear can hold you back.

>Do I have to come back from shifting?
No.

>Is Astral Projection Dangerous?
The only way it can be dangerous is if you believe it to be, and even then only to your mental state. You cannot be physically harmed.

threads.com:
Over the past few years I've been seeing things on the edge of my vision. Normally it would just be the silhouettes of people. I may see someone who isn't there walking out of a hallway, only to disappear when I look directly at them. Other times, they would walk behind something and disappear. The only consistent one was a very tall person with pale skin, wearing a suit, grinning at me from a doorway. Another time I thought I had run over someone with the forklift only to find nothing there. Then I started to see buildings. A saw a sheer steel wall, like some industrial building, with blinking red lights. Another time a gas station was replaced by a radio tower enveloped in fog. I saw some military vehicle parked where the fuel tanks are supposed to be at work. And now I'm getting auditory hallucinations as I'm falling asleep. A muffled slamming, like someone flinging a heavy door shut. I can even hear glass rattling like its disturbing the cops in the kitchen cabinet, three rooms away.
Am I just losing my shit or what?

Just know that just having these phenomena does not mean you are necessarily crazy, it just depends on how you start to act on them. For some people the gates are more open than others which can be both a blessing and a curse.
I would advice you to try to seek images, thoughts, places, vibes that somehow feel soothing to your soul and meditate on these to kind of draw your thoughts to a stable baseline.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33381387
Time speeding up is a subjective effect of aging, as each new year means less and less to you as it represents a smaller fraction of your total life. This is one part of it and I'm not sure you can do anything about it.
There's a 2nd part of it which may or may not apply to you but it does to a lot of people and that's the sheer monotony of their lives. When you end up doing the same thing every day, you don't even bother remembering most of it. Then at some point you take stock of your memories and you realize that you don't know what you did this week. And it feels like time slipped by you, cos you're used to having more experiences for the same amount of clock time. The solution here is to pay more attention and to engage in more activities that are meaningful to you.

>Who Is Franz Bardon?:
Franz Bardon was one of the most important figures in the occult revival of the twentieth century and the author of three influential books: Initiation into Hermetics, The Practice of Magical Evocation, and The Key to the True Kabbalah.

In 1941 he was arrested by the Nazis and after refusing to assist Hitler magically, was imprisoned in a concentration camp and tortured. He escaped his execution when the Allies bombed the camp where he was confined. He returned to his hometown after the war, continuing his occult work and writing the books for which he became well known. While studying, he made his living as a healer using alchemical preparations. Bardon was arrested in 1958 by the Czech government for publishing occult materials, and died in prison on July 10, 1958.

>What Is Hermetics?:
Hermeticism, or Hermetism, is a label used to designate a philosophical system that is primarily based on the purported teachings of Hermes Trismegistus.

-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

I live in a small building that is going to be renovated soon. As such, I'm the only person currently living in it, as my apartment is one of the only somewhat decent ones left. Earlier today, around twilight, the power went out for a little bit. Looking out the window, it looked like the power was out for the other residential buildings across the street. I went up to the roof to see how many buildings went dark and saw pic related. It was some guy with his arms out, or something. He wasn't moving much. It seriously weirded me out because the only way up the building to the roof was through a main hallway you could only get in with a key, and no one else is currently living in my small building. Did he break in or something? I was super creeped out.
Now, if I looked away or something and looked back and he was gone, I would assume he was some crackhead or something that got spooked when he saw me and fucking climbed down the side of the building in a panic. It's only a three story building anyway. But I didn't look away, and the humanoid figure/silhouette disappeared. It literally just faded away into nothingness without moving AS I WAS LOOKING AT IT. I crept close and looked around, finding jack shit. I went back downstairs and through the hall and the door you need a key to get through to get to the roof was still locked. So no one broke in. Shit still has me feeling uneasy.

I don't normally post on this board but I wanted to share this with someone.

Darkness = Chaos, Raw potential

Pegasus with the all seeing eye that reads minds
Cards becoming the literal avatars of God entities on this plane, that literally kill you if you disrespect them
Occult secret societies pulling the strings of the world from the shadows
the VR arc illustrating how the Matrix works plus Noah's arc

Yugi is meant to represent Horus, the son, Atem is Atum the chief God of the sun but also Osiris. Seto / Seth his brother aka Kaiba. Bakura with Zorc are literally the Snake Apep/Apophis primordial Chaos figure (Satan). This is just surface level but all of it is clearly there.

>>33389587
Yes, but you probably won't believe where it lies.
So let me put it this way - Think for a bit what you expect real truth to look like.

Do you expect it to look like a sentence in the English language? Why would a universal truth be definable using words that can be misunderstood?

Do you think it's going to be a proof you can write down using math and logic? How could it be, if you don't _already_ have truth to build from?
If you could build from math/logic and get the truth you're looking for then that math/logic would ALREADY be the truth you're looking for.

So it's clear that what you're looking for is an AXIOM. A true axiom of reality itself, not one that we make up to create a new system of logic.
But one that you discern from reality itself.
Something that needs no explanation, because it IS its own explanation... And the answer is, consciousness. And honestly, what else could it ever be? Of course it's consciousness. Science doesn't talk about it BECAUSE it's a real axiom. They only talk about axioms they choose (i.e. axioms they can already explain/define using language, which already means it's not a REAL axiom of reality).
And isn't consciousness really the most bizarre aspect of being alive? Even more bizarre than the idea of "matter" (which by the way you only know of because of consciousness, and it's trivial to re-create matter with consciousness but impossible to re-create consciousness with "matter").

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33389681
But how can consciousness be truth when it can be hacked with things like lsd, lies, and illusions?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33389707
You're mixing up consciousness itself with the things you derive from it.

For example, say we see an apple on a table. You're thinking the conscious experience is "apple" and it can be fooled because maybe it's just a hologram.
But "apple" is not the conscious experience. "Apple" is the conclusion you arrive to FROM your conscious experience (but then you throw away the consciousness and claim "apple" is the beginning).

So what I'm saying is that you don't actually see an "apple" at all. What you see is the color _red_ in a particular pattern and form. And can that ever be a lie?
Is the color red any less red if it's a hologram or a simulation?

So if you see the truth first, the color red, then your foundation is still solid even after you realize the "apple" was a hologram. Because the hologram was STILL made out of red. It's only the conclusion you drew from that experience of red that turned out to be wrong.

So in fact, what I'm talking about is the ONLY thing that cannot be faked. All fakes, lies, and illusions are made out of the thing I'm talking about. Simulations USE conscious experience, they don't create it.
